entry.title: Blocksize and off-chain transactions
entry.summary: In an email sent on March 13, 2013 at 6:01:02 PM, Michael Gronager corrected a statement regarding issues with the Bitcoin protocol. He noted that it was not version 0.8 that had issues, but rather version 0.7 and earlier. Despite their known issues, these earlier versions are significant because they define the Bitcoin protocol. This clarification highlights the importance of adhering to the established protocol, as version 0.8's failure to do so has created an issue. It is crucial for developers and users alike to understand and follow the protocol in order to maintain the integrity and stability of the Bitcoin network.
